text: Visited this place on a weekday during lunch. Was the only patrons at noon, so for a table for two, we were waited on by three staff members. Despite the high staff to customer ratios, refilling of water requires a degree of effort, which marred the dining experience. Food wise was decent, the trio of pork being a good value, but probably would not be sufficient for two big eaters. The serving of the course were well timed, and clearing of the dishes prompt. Overall, quite comfortable a place to dine, but could be perfect if staff could be more proactive in topping up of the water.

Appallingly poor food and service for the price, looks like all the staff worth anything must have jumped from the sinking ship.

Waiter didn't know what a rare steak was. Kitchen didn't know what a medium steak was. Pork rib was tough and leathery.

Eat anywhere else.

A small restaurant, slightly dated feel but you can argue the other way and say that there is some old world charm here. Delivers mainly angmoh food with a tapas menu, and for October they have an Oktoberfest promotion. During covid times there are a number of takeaway promotions. This is the flagship angmoh restaurant inside of RTC, not as posh as Churchill room at tanglin but also easier on the wallet
Quite good! Enjoy the food well.
Had a birthday dinner with wifey & son, both falls in April, 2 days apart. Small restaurant with private dining feel. Kudos to the crew who were attentive & prompt with their services.
